programme.title: Rambo III, (1988, Action)
programme.desc: Rambo refuses to join his friend and former mentor, Colonel Trautman, on a mission to Afghanistan. The mission fails and Trautman is captured by Russian troops. Now Rambo must infiltrate the Russian fortress to save his only friend.

programme.title: Vivarium, (2020, Thriller)
programme.desc: A couple‚Äôs search for a dream home plunges them into a terrifying nightmare after they are trapped in a mysterious, labyrinth-like neighborhood of identical houses.

programme.title: Pandorum, (2009, Sci-Fi Horror)

programme.title: Let Me In (2010), (2011, Vampires)
programme.desc: Owen, an overlooked and bullied boy, finds love and revenge through Abby (Chlo√´ Grace Moretz of KICK-ASS), a beautiful but peculiar girl who turns out to be a vampire.

programme.desc: Animal rights activists free a group of infected chimps to horrifying results. 28 days later, Jim wakes from a coma and explores a deserted London. He soon learns the truth behind the deserted streets and the menacing creatures that lurk in the shadows.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: Jotaro and his companions finally make it to a hotel in Singapore, but soon Polnareff falls into a trap set by a dangerous and brutal enemy.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Yellow Temperance
programme.desc: Joseph uses his Stand to generate a spirit message from a TV, only to receive a warning claiming that Kakyoin is a traitor. Meanwhile, Jotaro, Ann and Kakyoin are out exploring Singapore when Kakyoin begins acting strangely.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure
programme.desc: The Joestars' group arrives in India, where Polnareff is attacked by a Stand only visible through a mirror. As terrifying as it is, the Stand could also be related to his sister's murder.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Emperor and the Hanged Man Part 2
programme.desc: When Avdol is struck down defending Polnareff, the Frenchman goes into a state of shock, leaving him vulnerable. That is when "Hanged Man," Centerfold's Stand, begins its most furious attack.
programme.sub-title: The Emperor and the Hanged Man Part 2

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Empress
programme.desc: Jotaro and the others next head toward Varanasi. On their way there, Joseph realizes his arm is quite swollen. At first, it doesn't bother him much, but the bigger it gets, the creepier it looks.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Jotaro and his group head toward Pakistan by car. Polnareff is behind the wheel on a dangerous mountain road when a mysterious vehicle starts impeding their progress.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Justice Part 1
programme.desc: After surviving another attack, Jotaro and his team make it to Pakistan, where they stop at an inn to rest. The village around the inn, however, is quiet, and its inhabitants rather odd.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Justice Part 2
programme.desc: Polnareff realizes that Enyaba is a new assassin sent by DIO. He is prevented from warning his comrades by Enyaba's Stand "Justice," which has the ability to control corpses.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Lovers Part 1
programme.desc: After surviving Enyaba's attack, Jotaro and crew make it to Pakistan's capital, Karachi. There, they encounter DIO's next assassin, Dan of Steel.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Lovers Part 2
programme.desc: Dan of Steel's Stand, "The Lovers," has entered Joseph's brain. With Joseph's life on the line, Jotaro has no choice but to carry out Dan's orders, but the rest of his companions have their own say in the matter.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Sun
programme.desc: Jotaro and his fellows take camels and travel across the desert, headed for Cairo. Along the way, though, they can't shake the sensation that someone or something is watching their every move.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Death 13, Part 1
programme.desc: Kakyoin dreams about being in a strange amusement park, where he encounters the Death tarot card. While in the dream he witnesses Death cut down a dog, but after waking up in terror he can't remember what the nightmare was about.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Death 13, Part 2
programme.desc: Kakyoin tries to convince the others that the baby is a Stand user, but they merely start to doubt his sanity. Unable to persuade his friends, Kakyoin resorts to some extreme measures.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Judgment, Part 1
programme.desc: Jotaro and the team visit an island in the Red Sea and find Avdol's father, renewing the grief Polnareff felt over his friend's death. But perhaps there is a way he can right that wrong. Or not.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Judgment, Part 2
programme.desc: Polnareff revives his sister Shelly using one of his three wishes but is then attacked by her. The enemy Stand user, Cameo, then says he'll grant Polnareff's last wish and revives Avdol.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The High Priestess, Part 1
programme.desc: Jotaro and the others obtain a submarine as a new means of transport, but as they travel through the Red Sea they realize that there are few places to escape to should danger arise underwater.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The High Priestess, Part 2
programme.desc: The team attempts to escape the submarine with scuba gear as it sinks under attacks from the shape-changing enemy Stand "High Priestess."

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Iggy the Fool and Geb's N'doul, Part 1
programme.desc: Jotaro and his friends finally land in Egypt, where DIO awaits, and are cutting through the desert when a helicopter approaches. The helicopter belongs to the Speedwagon Foundation and is there to make a special delivery requested by Joseph.
programme.sub-title: Iggy the Fool and Geb's N'doul, Part 1

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Iggy the Fool and Geb's N'doul, Part 2
programme.desc: Jotaro and crew acquire the help of Iggy but are ambushed by a water Stand. With Kakyoin injured, Avdol tries out a stratagem which the unseen enemy quickly sees through. Meanwhile, Iggy is napping.
programme.sub-title: Iggy the Fool and Geb's N'doul, Part 2

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Khnum's Zenyatta and Thoth's Mondatta
programme.desc: After the battle with N'doul, Kakyoin and Avdol are badly hurt, so the group heads for a hospital in Aswan. Unfortunately, dangerous enemies could be all around them even there.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Anubis, Part 1
programme.desc: A young man named Chaka finds a mysterious sword on the beach. Though other men try, Chaka is the only one who can draw it. The sword claims Chaka as its master and sends the youth in pursuit of Jotaro and his friends with deadly intent.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Anubis, Part 2
programme.desc: Having defeated the "Anubis" Stand user Chaka, Polnareff pays a visit to a barber. But when the barber starts attacking him with Chaka's sword, the Frenchman realizes the sword itself is the Stand user.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Bast's Mariah, Part 1
programme.desc: On the way to Luxor, Joseph notices an electrical outlet set in a rock. Fascinated by the rare sight, Joseph goes in for a closer look and gets shocked. Though he seems fine afterward, soon all manner of small accidents begin to occur around him.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Bast's Mariah, Part 2
programme.desc: Due to the powers of an enemy Stand, Joseph's body becomes magnetized. While chasing after the woman he suspects is the Stand user, Joseph learns that Avdol has also become magnetized from touching a different electrical outlet.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Set's Alessi, Part 1
programme.desc: With Joseph and Avdol busy fighting Mariah, Jotaro and Polnareff get concerned about why they haven't shown up yet. As the two search Luxor, Polnareff senses someone following them and confronts the man.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Set's Alessi, Part 2
programme.desc: The power of Alessi's Stand "Set" has turned Polnareff back into a child, leaving him confused and alone. A passerby named Marena takes the boy into her home to help him, but they are followed by Alessi and his terrible powers.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: D'Arby the Gambler, Part 1
programme.desc: After a long journey, Jotaro and his friends finally reach Cairo. They begin asking about the location of DIO's palace and find one man who says he has information, but will only answer if the group can beat him in a game.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: D'Arby the Gambler, Part 2
programme.desc: After losing to D'Arby, Joseph and Polnareff have their souls taken. In order to have their souls returned, Jotaro shows off Star Platinum's powers before beginning a match with D'Arby, warning him that cheating won't work.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Hol Horse and Mondatta, Part 1
programme.desc: Hol Horse arrives at Cairo in order to pursue Jotaro and the others. He has joined forces with another partner and is after the lives of Jotaro and crew once more. What's more, his new partner is none other than Mondatta.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: Hol Horse and Mondatta, Part 2
programme.desc: Following Mondatta's prediction, Hol Horse sticks his fingers into Polnareff's nose, but he doesn't know what to do from there. Making matters worse, Jotaro and the others show up in search of Polnareff, forcing Hol Horse into a tough spot.

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Guardian of Hell, Pet Shop, Part 1
programme.desc: Jotaro and his friends continue to search for DIO's mansion in Cairo. Following Avdol's advice, they have a beggar look for the mansion and wait. Meanwhile, Iggy, wandering the city alone, is confronted by two large dogs.
programme.sub-title: The Guardian of Hell, Pet Shop, Part 1

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: The Guardian of Hell, Pet Shop, Part 2
programme.desc: Iggy ends up in a battle to the death in the sewers against Pet Shop, the falcon that guards DIO's mansion. Despite being injured, Iggy runs to the river in an attempt to escape, but he may have underestimated Pet Shop's abilities.
programme.sub-title: The Guardian of Hell, Pet Shop, Part 2

programme.title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: D'Arby the Player, Part 1
programme.desc: Though purchased dearly with Iggy's injury, Jotaro and his group finally have the location of DIO's palace. Waiting for them where they find the butler, Darby Younger, brother of the gambler they previously defeated.

programme.desc: The devil will find work for idle hands to do, but what happens when he chooses the laziest teen slacker in the world to do his dirty work? Anton Tobias is a couch potato burn-out who can't control the murderous impulses of his possessed hand. Rated: R

programme.title: Bad News Bears in Breaking Training, (1977, Comedy)
programme.desc: The story picks up the Bears career a year after their infamous second-place finish in the North Valley League. Faced with a chance to play the Houston Toros for a shot at the Japanese champs, they devise a way to get Texas to play at the famed Astrodome.

programme.title: Bad News Bears Go To Japan, (1978, Comedy)
programme.desc: Caught in a clash of cultures and ready to wreak more havoc on Japan than Godzilla, the Bad News Bears are back this time the Bears are spirited off to Tokyo by a slick and sleazy con artist who sees in the team a perfect peg for a get-rich-quick scheme.

programme.title: Pink Panther Strikes Again, (1976, Comedy)
programme.desc: Chief Inspector Dreyfus (Herbert Lom) is finally driven mad by Inspector Clouseau's (Peter Sellers) incompetence and commandeers a doomsday device along with a demand for Clouseau‚Äôs death. Are 26 hired assassins a match for Clouseau's dumb luck?

programme.title: Lenny, (1974, Comedy)
programme.desc: Dustin Hoffman magnificently captures the complexities and contradictions of the legendary comedian Lenny Bruce's mercurial character.

programme.title: Rancho Deluxe, (1975, Western)
programme.desc: Jack (Jeff Bridges) and Cecil (Sam Waterston) are an oddball team of modern-day Montana cattle rustlers, and they‚Äôve set their sights on a pair of unlikely ranch owners from New York (Clifton James, Elizabeth Ashley). But can they outfox the foxes?

programme.title: Thunderbolt and Lightfoot, (1974, Action)
programme.desc: Clint Eastwood and Jeff Bridges lead a strong supporting cast in this offbeat crime caper about a colorful group of bank robbers determined to break into the fortress-like Montana Armored Depository.

programme.title: The Bad News Bears, (1976, Comedy)
programme.desc: A major surprise as one of 1976's top-grossing films. THE BAD NEWS BEARS is a movie about children that is refreshing, utterly believable, and quite cleverly funny.

programme.title: Bad News Bears in Breaking Training, (1977, Comedy)
programme.desc: The story picks up the Bears career a year after their infamous second-place finish in the North Valley League. Faced with a chance to play the Houston Toros for a shot at the Japanese champs, they devise a way to get Texas to play at the famed Astrodome.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus announces that there are many strange secrets that will make his ultimate tournament unlike any they've ever had. Yugi must not only figure the rules out, but master them if he's to survive!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Yugi defeats Weevil's first wave of Duel Monsters, he's shocked to discover that Weevil has one last trick up his sleeve; a ravenous Great Moth that grows in power with every turn!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey finds himself courageously accepting a challenge from veteran duelist, Mai. But when Mai begins to demonstrate an unnerving psychic ability, Joey has to figure out Mai's secret strategy before falling victim to it!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The fisherman duelist baits Yugi into a duel on his own sea playing field for a home-field advantage. Can Yugi adapt to these new settings to turn the tide of battle?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: If Yugi is eliminated from the tournament, KaibaCorp's crooked Board of Directors will transfer control of the company from Kaiba to Pegasus! Kaiba's brother Mokuba challenges Yugi to a duel to protect his brother's company!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi must duel a magical doppelganger of Kaiba, created from the greed and power lust Yugi wiped from Kaiba's soul.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi defeats the Blue Eyes White Dragon, but there are two more waiting in the wings! Will the real Kaiba reach Yugi in time to help beat this impersonator?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey decides to battle Rex Raptor without his friends' help to prove that he is man enough to take care of Serenity on his own.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey duels valiantly, but Rex Raptor has unleashed his secret weapon: the Red-Eyes Black Dragon!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's classmate Bakura, possessed by his Millennium Ring's dark powers, traps Yugi and friends in a Shadow Game where they become the cards themselves!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus's hired duelist Panik cheats Mai of all her star chips, and Yugi vows to defeat him and win them back. But when Panik's Castle of Dark Illusions enshrouds his monsters in a black mist, how can Yugi defeat an enemy he cannot see?
programme.sub-title: The Light at the End of the Tunnel

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Despite his astonishing disadvantage, Yugi boldly provokes Panik - "I'll finish you in three turns." Is Yugi bluffing, or does he have the advantage in this battle of wits?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba descends to the kingdom to face Pegasus. Has Kaiba changed since his battle with Yugi, or is he still the same merciless duelist? A battle between Kaiba's Blue Eyes White Dragon and Joey's Red Eyes Black Dragon holds the answers!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Bandit Keith's gang kidnaps Joey to a secret cave with a graveyard playing field. As Yugi and friends search for him, Joey faces Bandit Keith's zombie monsters which become stronger as they return from the grave!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey's last-ditch effort, his lucky Time Wizard card, fails against Bandit Keith's zombie monsters. But as his lucky streak comes to an end, will his improving skills as a duelist and his love for his sister inspire him to victory?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and Joey band together in a team battle against the Paradox Brothers with all the Star Chips and entrance to Pegasus's castle on the line!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The Paradox Brothers summon the almighty Gate Guardian, a monster that reflects all attacks! Is Joey helping Yugi in this duel, or is his lack of experience sealing their fate for defeat?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and Joey each unleash their strongest monster, the Summoned Skull, and the Red-Eyes Black Dragon, but their strength pales in comparison to the tremendous power of the Gate Guardian.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: In order to earn the right to challenge Pegasus, Kaiba must first beat Yugi and take his Star Chips. The rematch between Yugi and Kaiba is about to begin!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba summons the Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon, the strongest monster in the game fused from three Blue-Eyes White Dragons! Yugi has lost all his powerful Duel Monsters, but a true duelist never gives up!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi begins spinning a strategy to put the Blue-Eyes Ultimate Dragon to rest, but he must decide whether to claim victory or spare Kaiba his life. Yugi's heart is split in two!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Having lost his star chips to Kaiba and his only opportunity to save Grandpa, Yugi is in a state of shock. Can Tea bring Yugi back to consciousness by defeating Mai for her extra star chips and teach Yugi the heart of the duelist?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi and friends enter the castle to discover Kaiba ready to duel Pegasus with Mokuba's soul hanging in the balance! The power of the Millennium Eye gives Pegasus the ability to read other people's minds.

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Kaiba is helpless against Pegasus's Toon World deck and mind-reading abilities. As the duel ends, Pegasus imprisons Kaiba's soul into a card, just like Grandpa and Mokuba!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi vows to overthrow Pegasus for the sake of his Grandpa. Tristan leads an exploration party to uncover Pegasus's secrets. While Joey sleeps, Bandit Keith steals from him the card that permits his entry in the final battle!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Under Pegasus's glare, Yugi is distracted from his duel with Mai. After making foolish errors and allowing Mai to gain a huge advantage with her Harpie's Pet Dragon, will Yugi gather his focus or succumb to the pressure?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Mai has rebounded from her previous loss to Joey to become a better duelist. Has Yugi learned from his loss to Kaiba, or is the emotional defeat still weighing on his heart? The answer is in the cards!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey searches for the card that permits him to enter the final battle, not realizing Bandit Keith has stolen it. As he struggles to accept the fact that Serenity will be blind forever, he receives help from a new friend!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: After Bandit Keith's Machine deck forces Joey to take the defensive, Joey mimics Keith's battle strategy to metalize his Red-Eyes Black Dragon! Is victory assured, or does the cheater Bandit Keith literally have one last card up his sleeve?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey challenges Yugi for the right to face Pegasus. In a battle between friends, a fierce match ensues between the two people who know each other's strategies and cards.
programme.sub-title: Best of Friends Best of Duelists, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi is shocked as Joey uses the Time Wizard card on him. It's the very same card Yugi gave Joey as a sign of friendship!
programme.sub-title: Best of Friends Best of Duelists, Part 2

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi prepares for the ultimate battle against Pegasus with the souls of Grandpa, Kaiba, and Mokuba on the line.
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 1

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Pegasus punishes Yugi using the same Toon Deck and mind-reading abilities he used on Kaiba. As Pegasus turns Yugi's monsters against him, Yugi loses the will to battle. Will Pegasus capture Yugi's soul into a card, just like Kaiba?
programme.sub-title: Yugi vs. Pegasus Match of the Millennium, Part 2

programme.title: With the help of the Sun Pirates, the Straw Hats see their chance to escape! And the Sun Pirates bid farewell to their former captain. Mama finally tastes the Wedding Cake and the results are positively scrumptious!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Captivating Flavor! Sanji's Cake of Happiness!

programme.title: The Big Mom Pirates fooled! The Straw Hats have eluded their would-be tormentors with the help of the Sun Pirates! However, as the fleet of the Big Mom Pirates is still coming after them, Jimbei makes a crucial decision to help the Sunny to get away.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Man of Humanity and Justice! Jimbei, a Desperate Massive Ocean Current!

programme.title: At a great cost of energy and life, the Straw Hats make it out of Totto Land. Left behind in their wake are allies and friends, and would-be lovers. As the sea opens before them, what price has been paid for their escape?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Parting Time! Pudding's Last Wish!

programme.title: Luffy's recent exploits make their way around the world! The reputation of this mighty pirate begins to grow as all eyes look towards the Straw Hats' next move! Also - German 66 leaves an artifact behind which excites the crew!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The World is Stunned! The Fifth Emperor of the Sea Emerges!

programme.title: As the royals make their way to the Reverie, the mighty Navy takes all precautions to make sure they don't fall prey to kidnappings! At the vanguard is Koby, who glimpses Luffy's exploits and remembers their shared past.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: To the Reverie! The Straw Hats' Sworn Allies Come Together!

programme.title: A vicious pirate group led by Pinkbeard who describes himself as one of Blackbeard's affiliates attacks a town in the Kingdom of Lulucia while their king and able-bodied soldiers have gone to the Reverie. And four bizarre individuals come to help.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sabo Goes into Action! All the Captains of the Revolutionary Army Appear!

programme.title: At New Marineford, Sakazuki, the new Admiral of the Fleet, hears the news about Luffy and recalls the tumultuous Paramount War that haunts the Navy! That game-changing war has repercussions that last into the present!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Going into Action! The Implacable New Admiral of the Fleet - Sakazuki!

programme.title: Nobles from around the world gather for the Reverie as the echoes of the Paramount War resound! Among them are Shirahoshi and her family from the Ryugu Kingdom under the sea. Meanwhile, Admiral Fujitora has a conversation with his new colleague.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Paramount War! The Inherited Will of the King of the Pirates!

programme.title: Stelly, Sabo's adopted brother and now the king of the Goa Kingdom, walks up to Garp who is escorting the royal family of the Fish-Man Island, with an air of importance and something up his sleeve.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: One Step Forward for Her Dream! Shirahoshi Goes Out in the Sun!

programme.title: Shirahoshi and her family finally reach the Holyland of Mariejois! But all the unexpected attention confuses her. Meanwhile, Vivi from Alabasta meets Leo and Rebecca from Dressrosa, and tells them the story of her journey with the Straw Hats.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: I Miss Him! Vivi and Rebecca's Sentiments!

programme.title: Vivi reunites with Dalton and Dr. Kureha from the Sakura Kingdom and they share their memories of the Straw Hats with Shirahoshi and Rebecca. Meanwhile, a shadowy figure descends a long staircase at the castle in the Holyland and opens a mysterious door.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: In the Dark Recesses of the Holyland! A Mysterious Giant Straw Hat!

programme.title: Shirahoshi crosses the fancy of a Celestial Dragon, and those living gods are not open to having their whims disobeyed! As she is dragged away, King Neptune comes to her rescue, risking life and limb by defying the Celestial Dragon.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Holyland in Tumult! The Targeted Princess Shirahoshi!

programme.title: The Emperors of the Sea, Big Mom and Kaido decide to team up against Luffy! Meanwhile, Garp hears about the wild exploits of his grandson, all while a mysterious outsider visits the highest authority in the world!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: An Explosive Situation! Two Emperors of the Sea Going After Luffy!

programme.title: After sneaking into the Land of the Gods, Sabo sees the shocking figure of his friend ‚Äì Kuma! Abused by the World Government as a pawn in their games, Kuma, who was made an example of what happens when you disobey the gods!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sabo Enraged! The Tragedy of the Revolutionary Army Officer Kuma!

programme.title: The Reverie has begun! The representative kings and queens first discuss what to do with Straw Hat Luffy. Meanwhile the Revolutionary Army confirms its desire to save Kuma! All while they recount how the Straw Hats have grown!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Finally, It Starts! The Conspiracy-filled Reverie!

programme.title: In order to recruit a strong ally towards bringing down Kaido, Cat Viper and his crew stop by Whitebeard's homeland to see Marco, the 1st division commander of the Whitebeard Pirates.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Marco! The Keeper of Whitebeard's Last Memento!

programme.title: Luffy and the others become excited as they see familiar faces in a newspaper article about the Reverie while they close in on the Land of Wano. But this dangerous and foreboding land is as inaccessible as it is mysterious! The sea itself is a barrier!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Climbing Up a Waterfall! A Great Journey Through the Land of Wano's Sea Zone!

programme.title: A mysterious country, a rampaging slasher, ancient samurai rituals of seppuku - and Zoro in the crosshairs! When a street assault occurs, all signs point to Zoro! Meanwhile, Luffy finally arrives at the Land of Wano.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Land of Wano! To the Samurai Country where Cherry Blossoms Flutter!

programme.title: Stranded alone on the beach, Luffy tries to gather his bearings only to be confronted by some mysterious, and dangerous, local fauna! And then, he meets a little girl named Otama! Meanwhile, Zoro makes trouble for the others who are trying to blend in!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Otama Appears! Luffy vs. Kaido's Army!

programme.title: Otama's gratitude towards Luffy knows no bounds! But the feast she cooks him exhausts her food stores completely! As she suffers from poor drinking water, her companion tells the story of the mysterious outsider she waits for - Ace!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: He'll Come! The Legend of Ace in the Land of Wano!

programme.title: Ambushed and outgunned by a skilled bounty hunter Cidre's group, the Straw Hats rely on the Sunny's Coup de Burst to escape! But they end up stranded without cola! A nearby soda island offers a solution.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Side Story! The World's Greatest Bounty Hunter, Cidre!

programme.title: Luffy and Boa Hancock square off against the Cidre Guild! These unscrupulous bounty hunters have one thing in mind - profit at any cost! When the battle looks won, Cidre gears up in a menacing power suit!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Side Story! Clash! Luffy vs. the King of Carbonation!

programme.title: Otama recounts her promise to Ace while Luffy rushes her to medical attention. But just as they reach the wasteland, a familiar face comes into view! But Kaido's underlings show up too!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Save Otama! Straw Hat, Bounding through the Wasteland!

programme.title: Otama's temperature is going up and Luffy has no time to waste! However, Hawkins, one of Kaido's Headliners, blocks their way by showing his unique powers and skills which can harm his own men.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Headliner! Hawkins the Magician Appears!

programme.title: Luffy and Zoro have been stalled by Hawkins but their fortune looks bright as they are guided by a woman who Zoro had saved. She leads them to a teahouse and to an herbal remedy for the river poison.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Defeat is Inevitable! The Strawman's Fierce Attack!

programme.title: Otama's life is saved by Otsuru at her teahouse. The proud Otama finds it hard to take more kindness. The group learns of the Okobore Town - living on the cast-offs of the officials! Then, suddenly, they were attacked by the Shogun's men!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Greatest Day of My Life! Otama and Her Sweet Red-bean Soup!

programme.title: Otama has been kidnapped by the Gifters! She is taken to a flourishing town called Bakura Town where a creepy-looking Headliner was expecting her. Luffy and Zoro rush to rescue her along with a samurai, Okiku!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Charging into the Enemy's Territory! Bakura Town - Where Officials Thrive!

programme.title: As Luffy, Zoro, and Okiku bounce through Bakura Town on Komachiyo's back, a sumo wrestler comes flying towards them! Interested, they go down to watch sumo but the undefeated yokozuna Urashima has been expecting Okiku there.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Yokozuna Appears! The Invincible Urashima Goes After Okiku!

programme.title: Luffy challenges Urashima, the strongest yokozuna in the Land of Wano, to a sumo match! Urashima even uses illegal moves to beat Luffy at any cost! Meanwhile, Holdem tells Otama that he knows she committed a crime and he has to punish her for it.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Climactic Sumo Battle! Straw Hat vs. the Strongest Ever Yokozuna!

programme.title: After sending the yokozuna Urashima flying, Luffy and his clan continue their search for Bakura Town's boss to save Otama! They finally find the boss, Holdem, one of the Beast Pirates' Headliners.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Luffy Rages! Rescue Otama from Danger!

programme.title: Facing Holdem who is holding Otama as hostage, Luffy prepares for a fight but Okiku tries to stop him by sharing who is really ruling the region. Meanwhile, Basil Hawkins is confronted by a mysterious figure.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Taking Back Otama! A Fierce Fight Against Holdem!

programme.title: Taking down Holdem, Luffy rescues Otama and tries to catch up to Zoro and Okiku who stole the food treasure ship and started a mad dash to get out of the town!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Duel! The Magician and the Surgeon of Death!

programme.title: This is a story of Luffy in an alternate reality. While sailing on the sea by himself, a strange bird crashes into his small boat. He looks up to find a giant ship where a girl named Ann has been captured. It seems like the bird belongs to her.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Political fixer Pomade Jaws trusts no one, not even his wife Laura. He's stored the scandalous secrets of various world leaders inside a voice-activated safe.
programme.sub-title: The Woman Pops Fell in Love With

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin, Jigen and Goemon have turned themselves in to the FBI, but it's all part of the plan. Their real goal is to break out old man Clyde Barlow, who was once known as a genius bank robber, to get his help with their heist of the National Super Bank.
programme.sub-title: A Classical Thief and a Myna

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Isamu Kondo III, grandson of the leader of the Shinsengumi, hires Lupin and his gang to recover a golden cannon sunk by the Shogunate forces in the Tsugaru Strait. After much effort, the valuable golden cannon is finally recovered from the deep ocean.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Ellery Queen, the owner of the legendary sapphire called "The Eye of Solomon," is also the owner of a football team. Lupin, coming for the sapphire as announced, discovers Queen on the brink of death.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The 3rd Thieves Olympic is about to be held in Japan, and Lupin and Jigen are in it to win it! After winning the first and second Thieves Olympic, if they also win this year's getaway race, they'll become the first-ever Triple-Crown winners!
programme.sub-title: Through the Flowers or Storms, The Thieves Race

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The world's largest diamond has been discovered in South Africa and Lupin has his eyes on the prize. But as it turns out, stealing it is the easy part!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko decides to marry Huffner for his jewelry collection, disregarding the rumor that Huffner's brides always die a mysterious death within a few weeks of their wedding. Turns out, he's also a collector of brides and likes them permanently preserved!
programme.sub-title: A Wedding Dress Doesn't Suit Fujiko

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Jigen receives a letter from Sister Angelica and heads to the African country of Borodias. Sister Angelica wants Jigen's help to rescue Dr. Othello, the leader of the country's independence movement.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The ICPO tries a different approach to capturing Lupin: Astrology. It enlists the help of Marianne, a clairvoyant who can read Lupin's actions using astrological predictions and her crystal ball.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko calls Lupin from Professor Pot's lab, but since Lupin is half-asleep, Jigen takes the call instead. Fujiko claims Professor Pot has accidentally invented a robot that manufactures diamonds, but Jigen doesn't believe a word she says and hangs up.
programme.sub-title: Diamon's Shining in the Robot's Eye

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Fujiko has invited Lupin and company to a classical concert conducted by Kyoransky from the International Philharmonic. After they get a good look at Kyoransky's baton, studded with a a diamond worth at least 200 million yen.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin goes to prison intent on making Silver tell what he did with the loot, only to discover that a new top-of-the-line prison was built over the site where he hid the money. Will the operation to trade an execution for the recovery of the money succeed?
programme.sub-title: The Last Gift in Prison is Cup Ramen

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin is after the Golden Bell, symbol of the monarchy of Beltenberg and precious tourist attraction. However, the bell that sparkles in the belfry is just a brass replica.
programme.sub-title: Fujiko, Men are A Sorry Lot!

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Zenigata is taken hostage from ICPO headquarters. The terrorists demand to swap him with their boss Napoleon XI, but ICPO refuses. Since Zenigata is no further use to them, the terrorists are bound to kill him; but Lupin is to the rescue?

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The Smith Gang hit-man company was once the best in the business, but they're suffering now from tough competition. Though the company chairman Smith considers running TV ads to revive his business, he can't think of a good way to do it.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Though Joe Spade was once a formidable hitman of renown and Jigen's sharpshooter coach, he now comes to beg for Jigen's help; he had gotten old, flubbed a hit contract, and is now on the run.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: ICPO Bureau Chief Jasmine is an able commissioner. She uses the governor to spur Zenigata into action, as she has a secret plan to arrest Lupin. But Jasmine's plan is to make this mission her very last at ICPO so she could get married.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Nightlight Mask murdered the Duke of Le Mond and stole his diamonds. ICPO is having trouble solving the case, so they induct mystery author Conan Dorill as a special inspector. Dorill deduces that the true identity of Nightlight Mask is Lupin.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: On a night of thunder and rain, a man gives Lupin a doll. The next day there is a news report that a diamond called the Phoenix's Tear had been stolen. Lupin's been caught on security cameras, but he has no recollection of having done the deed.
programme.sub-title: When the Devil Calls to Lupin

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin's target is the Vatican Crown, located at the North Pole. He devises a plan to thwart pesky Fujiko, which is to relocate penguins at the South Pole to the North Pole.
programme.sub-title: Lupin's North Pole, South Pole Adventures

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: The World Crime Prevention Devices Association has developed the "killer safe" that sent many safe crackers to their graves. But Lupin takes the challenge to steal what it guards.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin crashes crime boss Markane's masquerade party, but the party was just a ruse to entrap Lupin. Lupin gets hung by rope in the dark and is made the target of Markane's murder game in ten rounds, of which players have to hit the target.
programme.sub-title: The Badder A Guy, The More Villainous He Is

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin gets called out to New York where he rescues a girl hunted by an organization called Red Spider. Lupin does everything he can to help the poor girl suffering from amnesia; he tries hypnosis on her but to no avail, he gets hypnotized instead.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Old man Piccolo had taught Lupin the art of thievery 15 years ago. Learning that his widowed wife had all of her belongings impounded by the police, Lupin promises her to get them all back.
programme.sub-title: The Merry Widow and the Robber's Quartette

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and crew sneak into Peking's Imperial Palace Museum to steal Emperor Shi's jade Mahjong set, but winds up getting chased by a gang.
programme.sub-title: Operation INVADER at the Great Wall of China

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Look who is flying above New York; it's Superman! All he does is fly around, but the town is in a panic because of his performance. In the meantime, a lot of banks get robbed.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
